title: Asset parameters, by default applied into extra_vars

udc_endpoint.title: Choose Supported Platform
udc_endpoint.description: Define supported devices to map. The list of acceptable values can be found: https://github.kyndryl.net/Continuous-Engineering/ansible_project_udc#currently-supported-devices

bac_id.title: BlueID Account ID
bac_id.description: BAC-ID is a unique identifier on an account from BlueID system.

chipid.title: CHIP ID
chipid.description: ECM (Enterprise Compliance Management) supports GEO lists of active Account's Chip ID which is updated everyday. Can be left as default.

udc_results.title: udc_results
udc_results.description: Controls if results should be created and uploaded to SFS.

udc_ecm.title: udc_ecm
udc_ecm.description: Controls if results should be created and sent to ECM. Accepted values are 'off', 'create', 'send'. Default is 'create'.

udc_escm.title: udc_escm
udc_escm.description: Controls if results should be created and sent to ESCM. Accepted values are 'off', 'create', 'send'. Default is 'create'.

udc_aiops.title: udc_aiops
udc_aiops.description: Controls if results should be created and sent to AIOps. Accepted values are 'off', 'create', 'send'. Default is 'send'.

udc_uat.title: udc_uat
udc_uat.description: Controls if results should be created and sent to UAT. Accepted values are 'off', 'create', 'send'. Default is 'send'.

udc_invscanner.title: udc_invscanner
udc_invscanner.description: Controls if results should be created and sent to Inventory Services. Accepted values are 'off', 'create', 'send'. Default is 'send'.
